reviews.title: Difficulties checking out
reviews.text: We stayed in the Scandic Hotel oct 2002. The rooms were ok, bar was deserted at Saterday night! The reason was that most of the guests are businesspeople who stay there during the week; much less over the weekends. Because the hotel is at about a 1 Hour(!!!) walk from the city centre, not many tourists stay there. Overall the breakfast was very good. We payed everything in advance, but when checking out, they couldn't find our payment. It took quite some time to convince them that the payment was made, and only after threatening to deduct it (again!) from our creditcard, we werre to fax them the receipt afterwards. Also, when checking in you are to leave 250 Euro for possible damages or minibar usage. Something that wasn't mentioned before in any brochure...

This modern hotel was next to impossible for our coach driver to find in the dark, especially as we were 2.1/2 hours later than anticipated in our arrival, due to being held up on the notorious Brussels ring road for ages!
reviews.title: Next to impossible to find in the dark!

reviews.text: We found our comfortable room (one with disabled facilities) to the the farthest from the lift (next to the stairs!) which was a bit odd to say the least, but at least the beds were very comfortable. The food/restaurant however, was not exactly as expected.........

reviews.title: Great hotel, average location
reviews.text: Because we were tired, we dumped our baggage in the room and headed straight for the bar and restaurant. Too late! The restaurant was full and we were told there was no possibility of getting a table that night! Bar snacks were suggested and gratefully accepted. We were the lucky ones. People who actually got in the restaurant were patiently waiting for their food, and many left still hungry after 2-3 hours waiting! (I pity the poor lady who decided to forego the starters & move straight onto the main course - She never got it!

reviews.text: Reception staff were helpful and service was good. Free car parking was a bonus. Rooms were comfortable. Breakfast was excellent with a wide choice of food. It is a pleasant 2km walk into the city centre.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Scandic is well placed for visiting the beautiful and interesting city of Brugge. It is set in a large park on the outer ring road about 2km from the old city.
reviews.title: Clean, efficient and relaxed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We walked into the town using the route provided at reception. They arrange a very useful taxi service to and from the town. For 14 euros you get a return trip. If one portion is not used it is redeemed at the desk.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: The hotel reception staff were extremely helpful, offering advice, maps and even printing off routes to onward destinations.

reviews.text: The hotel is clean and modern (built 2001). Rooms are very clean with plenty of towels etc.

reviews.title: Very friendly staff
reviews.text: We booked our stay at the Scandic Brugge through an European reservations website. When we got there, they couldn't find it because somehow the reservation had been cancelled. The reception desk clerk, Bart (yes, like the Simpsons), was sooo kind and sooo nice he went out of his way to make us feel welcome and to find us another two rooms for the same price we had originally booked. He also arranged our shuttle taxi to the city center which was very convenient. Although we had our own rental car, parking is very expensive downtown, so the taxi for 14.00EUR for 4 people seemed reasonable. The hotel is located a bit far from city center, but this shuttle service is very reliable and convenient, and they drop you off just one block from the cathedral square where all city tours depart from.
The rooms are american standard as far as size and decoration, very clean and comfortable. Breakfast was included in our rate and was well worth it.

reviews.title: Like in a ferry tale
reviews.text: What a terrific hotel! The bed was so comfy I didn't want to get up in the morning. Beautiful hard wood floors and very clean. The food was fantastic. We enjoyed breakfast and dinner there. The hotel was a bit out of the city center. However, we drove our car so transportation wasn't a problem. The hotel has a huge car park and its free.

reviews.title: General
reviews.text: The Scandic hotel has an arrangement with a taxi compani so they bring you for 10 € up and down to town center but it takes ages before a taxi is available in town center to bring you back to the hotel. For 2 or 3 euros more any taxi brings you to the hotel from any place in town center.
